author: world today news
title: Hera shares pictures of Earth from a distance of 1.4 million kilometers
text:
Liputan6.com, Jakarta – Hera Space Shuttle share the first photo taken from space. The robot, which was launched on October 7, 2024, uses three instruments to take images.
Launching the European Space Agency (ESA) page on Thursday (17/10/2024), the spacecraft took a photo earth from a distance of 1.4 to 1.6 million kilometers as proof that the instruments are working properly. This image was taken by the Thermal Infrared Imager (TIRI) instrument developed by the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA).
From the image shared on ESA’s official website, the TIRI instrument captured an image of the earth in the center led by the North Pole at the top. In the upper right corner of the image, you can see the appearance of the moon.
In addition to using TIRI, Hera also took pictures of Earth using an optical camera and the HS-H multicolor spectroscopy camera. As a result, the earth looks brighter and feels very close to Hera even though the actual distance is almost 2 million kilometers.
This shared image shows that the TIRI, optical camera, and HS-H multicolor spectroscopic camera can work properly. All these instruments will later be used to take pictures of the asteroids Dimorphos and Didymos .
Before that, the last mission from ESA was tasked with further investigating the impact of the DART mission’s collision with the asteroid Dimorphos. ESA launched Hera using a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket at 10.52 ET (21.52 WIB) from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida, United States.
Space exploration It is accompanied by two CubeSats, a group of small satellites that are expected to reach the asteroid Dimorphos in 2026. The three will perform a “crime scene investigation” to solve the remaining mysteries of the double asteroid system.
When it gets there, this spacecraft will be nearly 195 million kilometers from Earth. Hera will also stop before Mars in mid-March 2025.
This will give the spacecraft the extra momentum it needs to reach Didymos and Dimorphos two years after launch. In addition to testing its 11 instruments, Hera will fly within 6,000 kilometers of the surface of Mars and see one of the two Martian moons, namely Deimos, from a distance of 1,000 kilometers.
2024-10-17 18:00:00
#Hera #shares #pictures #Earth #distance #million #kilometers

author: Cutter Martin
title: First Alert Weather Day | Plan on a scorching hot afternoon
text: First Alert: Hot today with spotty afternoon and evening storms ATLANTA, Ga. (Atlanta News First) - Plan on another scorching hot afternoon across north Georgia. It’ll feel even hotter with the mugginess factored in. Today is a First Alert Weather Day. A Heat Advisory is in effect for a portion of east Georgia; generally south and east of the immediate metro. It’ll feel hotter than 106° in these communities. Temperatures peak in the mid-90s between 4 and 6 p.m. It’ll feel like it’s between 103° an 106° in Atlanta. Stay hydrated. Find some shade, if you can. Avoid strenuous outdoor activity during the hottest time of day; generally the early afternoon through the early evening. Like yesterday, spotty showers and storms will bubble up in the afternoon heat. One, or two, may produce frequent lightning, small hail and gusty winds. You can be alerted to cooling downpours approaching your plans in the [First Alert Weather App](https://www.atlantanewsfirst.com/page/atlanta-news-first-apps-for-ios-and-android-devices/). The greatest chance of hit-or-miss storms occurs during the late afternoon and evening hours. Copyright 2024 WANF. All rights reserved.

author: folsomlocalnews.com
title: Lorain mayor presents proclamations to staff, supporters of Lorain Schools
text:
Lorain Mayor Jack Bradley honored members of the Lorain City Schools staff and staff of Palm Elementary School during a proclamation ceremony Dec. 3 at City Hall, according to a news release issued by Christa Lokiec, director of communications and community relations at Lorain City Schools.
“The event was organized by Angela Camille, a radiant individual known for spreading positivity and illuminating the spaces and lives around her,” Lokiec said. “Her heartfelt request highlighted the honorees’ hard work, dedication and significant contributions to education, the district and its students.”
The individual proclamations were presented to: Timothy Jama, an administrator at Lorain High School; Rosemary Benson, a retired teacher;
Brian Pagan, a teacher at General Johnnie Wilson Middle School; Jay Ferguson, a Board of Education member, who also is a retired teacher and administrator; and Cassandra Robinson, retired store director at Meijer in Lorain, who is a longtime supporter of Lorain Schools.
The ceremony was well-attended, with an audience comprised of colleagues and family members of those being recognized, Lokiec said.
During the event, Bradley personally presented proclamations to each recipient, “taking time to say something special to each person as he gave out the awards,” Lokiec said.
“I find that it is absolutely paramount and important to give thanks to those that have really gone above and beyond,” Camille said. “One thing that everyone on the requests have in common, is their passion for helping students and making a positive impact in education.”
The ceremony was a meaningful recognition of the educational professionals’ efforts and achievements, celebrating their important work in supporting students and the community, Lokiec said.

organizations.name: Lorain Schools Local News Local News

author: Jorge López
title: Los geólogos advierten: el mar Mediterráneo puede desaparecer del mapa
text:
Los geólogos advierten: el mar Mediterráneo puede desaparecer del mapa
Está atrapado entre dos placas tectónicas
El mar Mediterráneo, uno de los mares más famosos del mundo, podría estar en peligro de extinción en decenas de millones de años debido al lento choque de las placas tectónicas africana y euroasiática. Estas placas se acercan cada año unos milímetros y, en un futuro lejano, este movimiento podría provocar la desaparición total del mar.
Los geólogos sugieren que el Mediterráneo puede estar atrapado entre dos placas, lo que resultaría en la formación de una nueva cadena montañosa similar al Himalaya en su lugar.
¿Qué pasó antes?
El Mediterráneo ya ha enfrentado cambios dramáticos antes. Hace unos 5,97 millones de años se produjo la crisis de salinidad del Messiniense, cuando el mar se secó casi por completo, convirtiéndose en una gigantesca piscina de sal.
Se han producido procesos similares a lo largo de millones de años y los científicos confían en que el Mediterráneo permanecerá en su forma actual durante millones de años más.
¿Sobre qué advierten los científicos?
El estudio nos recuerda la actividad constante de nuestro planeta y el papel de los procesos tectónicos en su cambio. Destaca cómo la tectónica de placas puede transformar continentes, cambiando no sólo la apariencia de la Tierra, sino también las condiciones climáticas y ambientales de las regiones.

author: PTI
title: India News | 'Satyamev Jayate': AAP After SC Grants Interim Bail to Kejriwal | LatestLY
text:
India News | 'Satyamev Jayate': AAP After SC Grants Interim Bail to Kejriwal Get latest articles and stories on India at LatestLY. The AAP on Friday hailed the Supreme Court for granting interim bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy scam case filed by the ED, saying "satyamev jayate" . Agency News PTI | Jul 12, 2024 11:22 AM IST A+ A- New Delhi, Jul 12 (PTI) The AAP on Friday hailed the Supreme Court for granting interim bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy scam case filed by the ED, saying "satyamev jayate" .
Also Read | Arvind Kejriwal Granted Bail: Supreme Court Orders Delhi CM To Be Released on Interim Bail in ED Case.
Kejriwal, who is the national convenor of the AAP, however, will remain in jail as the CBI had subsequently arrested him in a corruption case related to the alleged scam.
"Satyamev Jayate (truth alone triumphs)", the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) posted on X in Hindi along with a picture of Kejriwal holding the national flag.
Also Read | Arvind Kejriwal Gets Interim Bail: Supreme Court Grants Bail to Delhi CM in Excise Policy Linked Money Laundering Case.
While granting the interim bail, the apex court said Kejriwal has suffered incarceration for over 90 days. --
(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

author: archyde
title: Parents Can Now Access Elementary School Grades Online
text:
Parents Can Now Access Student Grades Online
SET-126-2024
December 05, 2024
The Tamaulipas State Secretary of Education has announced the launch of a new online platform allowing parents and guardians to convenient access their children’s elementary school grades.
Marcela Ramírez Jordán, Undersecretary of Basic Education, responsible for the initiative, confirmed that the grades corresponding to the first evaluation period of the 2024-2025 school year are now readily available for families to review. The platform also grants access to previous school cycles.
“We have done this to guarantee timely and transparent access to students’ academic information,” Ramírez Jordan emphasizes, highlighting its alignment with the official school activities calendar. He added that parents and guardians can access the platform’s grade consultation service on the official website of the Ministry of Education.
Simple Online Access for Parents
***
Finding the necessary information is straightforward, according to officials. The Comprehensive Educational Information System ( SIIE ) website houses the “Grade Consultation” option under its “Online Services” menu. Accessing student grades is as simple as entering their CURP (Unique Population Registry Code) and selecting the appropriate academic term.
Thisone-stop shop for academic progress aligns with the Américo Villarreal Anaya administration’s commitment to enhance service accessibility through modern digital portals improved administrative efficiency. ”
“We want to make life easier for parents and guardians,” added Ramírez Jordan, acknowledging the significance of transparency and streamlined access to key educational data.
“We want to make life easier for parents and guardians,” added Ramirez Jordan, acknowledging the significance of transparency and streamlined access to key educational data.
How ⁢does the new platform ensure the security⁤ and privacy of student data? ## New Online ⁤Platform Gives Parents Access to Student Grades
**Interviewer:** Welcome to⁤ the show, Undersecretary Ramírez Jordán. I’d like ⁣to talk about this exciting new platform the State Secretary of Education has⁤ launched. Can you tell our viewers about it?
**Undersecretary Ramírez Jordán:** ⁤ Thank you for having me.⁢ We‍ are thrilled to ‍announce the launch of our ⁢new online platform that ⁤allows parents and⁢ guardians to easily access their ⁣children’s elementary school grades. The first evaluation ‌period grades ​for the 2024-2025 school year are now available, and families can also view previous school cycle results.
**Interviewer:** This⁣ sounds incredibly convenient! What prompted the creation of ‌this ‌platform?
**Undersecretary​ Ramírez Jordán:** Our goal is ‌to ensure timely and transparent access to student academic​ information. This platform allows parents‍ to stay informed about⁤ their child’s progress throughout the ⁣school year, aligning with‍ our official activities calendar.
**Interviewer:** We understand accessibility is very important. Where can parents access this new platform?
**Undersecretary Ramírez Jordán:** We’ll be making announcements with details about ⁣the platform’s location and access instructions very soon. We encourage all parents to stay tuned for further updates.

author: R7.com
title: Aluna nova? Cobra altamente venenosa é encontrada em escola de Florianópolis
text:
Aluna nova? Cobra altamente venenosa é encontrada em escola de Florianópolis
Bombeiros explicam como evitar acidentes com cobras e outros animais peçonhentos, que costumam sair de seus esconderijos no verão
ND Mais|Do R7
Um filhote de jararaca, cobra altamente venenosa, foi encontrado sob o bebedouro de uma escola em Florianópolis, na manhã desta quarta-feira (5). O CBMSC (Corpo de Bombeiros Militar de Santa Catarina) foi acionado para capturar o animal.
Consulte a matéria completa no nosso parceiro ND Mais e saiba mais sobre como se proteger de encontros com essa espécie perigosa!
Leia Mais em ND Mais:

author: Vatican News
title: Sant'Egidio accueille les réfugiés afghans arrivés grâce aux couloirs humanitaires - Vatican News
text: Vatican News Ces afghans au nombre de 191, arrivés par un vol en provenance d'Islamabad, étaient réfugiés au Pakistan depuis août 2021, et ont passé près de trois ans dans des conditions extrêmement précaires dans un camp informel au centre d'Islamabad. Car, après la chute de Kaboul et la grande mobilisation initiale, beaucoup d'Afghans qui ont réussi à se sauver en se réfugiant dans les pays voisins, attendent toujours d’être réinstallés. Ils sont arrivés grâce aux couloirs humanitaires promus par la Conférence épiscopale italienne, la Communauté de Sant'Egidio, les Églises protestantes italiennes et l’Association italienne de loisirs et de culture, en accord avec les ministères de l'Intérieur et des Affaires étrangères. Parmi ces familles et ces personnes, «il y a 71 mineurs et 70 femmes». Un moment d'accueil [ Read Also ] Ce samedi 22 juin, à 16 heures, à l'école de langue et de culture italiennes, Via di San Gallicano 25a, les réfugiés participeront à un moment d'accueil et de célébration avec leurs familles et les médiateurs qui contribueront à leur intégration, en commençant par l'apprentissage de la langue italienne, la scolarisation, pour les mineurs, et l'insertion professionnelle, pour les adultes. Plus de 7 400 réfugiés arrivés Au total, les couloirs humanitaires, promus par les différentes associations, ont permis jusqu'à présent l'arrivée en toute sécurité de plus de 7 400 réfugiés en Europe, dont 1 200 Afghans. Ce projet, entièrement autofinancé, est mis en œuvre grâce à un vaste réseau d'accueil, soutenu par la générosité de nombreux citoyens italiens, et représente un modèle de réussite, alliant solidarité et sécurité.
